answers.answer: HHi,Thank you for writing in on behalf of your son.The symptoms of diabetes can vary a great deal and sometimes may not be "classic", so I do think your son should have either a fasting glucose or an oral glucose tolerance test(a 2 hour test) done to see if he has diabetes or even a milder form of glucose intolerance.  The high blood pressure can certainly contribute to his fatigue so that should be treated. From a hormonal side, I think he should also be checked for thyroid problems and possibly Cushings syndrome(but the latter may depend somewhat on his physical examination findings as well.) A thorough history obtained by his doctor may give suggestions of other possible diagnoses. He should speak with his doctor about those I listed, as well as possible sleep apnea or a neurological condition that may cause some of the symptoms. Overall I do agree he should have a good physical exam and be seen by his physician soon.Take care and all the best to you and your son.

question: I am in this section because it sort of applies.  My son is 41 years old.  He hasgastric reflux, belching, extreme fatigue after meals (so he has limited his meals to one per day because he does not want to feel bad at work), he says he has frequent urination, he is very stocky even though he eats less than his wife (he gets very bloated feeling quickly) that weighs 105 pounds.  He said his vision is blurry from Nov to March usually and he thought it was allergies but I don't know what that would be.  He yawns all the time and has trouble sleeping and he has untreated high blood pressure.  Besides high blood pressure, do you have any idea where we can start to find out what might be ailing him?  I thought about type two diabetes but I am not sure he has all the symptoms;he says he is not overly thirsty.  Thanks so much.  Sincerely, a very concerned mom
title: Question Mystery Diagnosis
